description:
You are given an integer array a1,a2,…,an. In one operation, you can choose an integer x (0≤x≤1e18) and replace a[i] with ⌊(a[i]+x)/2⌋ (⌊y⌋ denotes rounding y down to the nearest integer) for all i from  1 to  n . 

Pay attention to the fact that all elements of the array are affected on each operation.

Return the smallest number of operations required to make all elements of the array equal.

Input

The first line of each testcase contains a single integer n.

The second line contains n integers a1,a2,…,an.

Output

Return the smallest number of operations required to make all elements of the array equal.

```
Sample Input 1 : 

6

2 1 2 1 2 1

Output 

1
```

```
Sample Input 2 : 

2

0 32

Output 

6
```

Constraints :

`1≤n≤2⋅1e5`

`0≤a[i]≤1e9`
title: Count number of Divide
